title: Big Mama Thornton The Original Hound Dog(rock)(mp3@320)[rogercc]
description:
BIG MAMA THORNTON THE ORIGINAL HOUND DOG
Label Ace 
Original Year 1990
Format:Mp3@320CBR


This British  compilation of Peacock sides is a bit more comprehensive than the  MCA Hound Dog anthology, including a few more tracks (22 in all, some previously unreleased).



Willie Mae "Big Mama" Thornton (December 11, 1926 ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬Å“ July 25, 1984) was the first to record the hit song "Hound Dog" in 1952. The song was #1 on the Billboard R&B charts for seven weeks in 1953 The B-side was "They Call Me Big Mama," and the single sold almost two million copies. Three years later, Elvis Presley recorded his version, based on a version performed by Freddie Bell and the Bellboys. In a similar occurrence, she wrote and recorded "Ball 'n' Chain," which became a hit for her.
 Janis Joplin later recorded "Ball and Chain," and was a huge success in the late 1960s.
